member.name: T:SIS.Validation.ValidationRule
member.summary: ValidationRule is designed to be a simple as possible to reduce overhead in run-time. It's because each validation rule can be attach to a control, so we can have a many instances of this class.

member.name: P:SIS.Validation.ValidationRule.IsValid
member.summary: Get validity of control value after Validate method is called.

member.name: P:SIS.Validation.ValidationRule.InitialValue
member.summary: A mandatory value does not necessarily mean a value other than "". In some cases, a default control value might be used as a prompt e.g. using "[Choose a value]" in a DropDownList control. In this case, the required value must be different than the initial value of "[Choose a value]". InitialValue supports this requirement. The default is "".

member.name: P:SIS.Validation.ValidationRule.IsRequired
member.summary: Cause validation to check if field is required.

member.name: P:SIS.Validation.ValidationRule.Operator
member.summary: Get or set operator to use to compare.

member.name: P:SIS.Validation.ValidationRule.ValueToCompare
member.summary: Get or set value use to compare with the control value.

member.name: P:SIS.Validation.ValidationRule.RegExPattern
member.summary: Regular Expression Pattern to use for validation.

member.name: E:SIS.Validation.ValidationRule.CustomValidationMethod
member.summary: Allow for attachment of custom validation method.
